## PathUtils class

Path utilities.

Provides POSIX-like path manipulation helpers (pure string operations), including normalization, joining, dirname/basename/extname extraction, absolute-path detection, and relative path computation.

Notes: - Uses "/" as the separator (web/URL or POSIX-like paths). - All methods are pure and do not touch a real filesystem. - `normalize` collapses ".", "..", and redundant slashes.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare class PathUtils 
```

## Methods

<table><thead><tr><th>

Method


</th><th>

Modifiers


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[basename(path, ext)](doc/markdown/./base.pathutils.basename.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Returns the last portion of a path (file name).

Behavior: - Applies `normalize` first. - If `ext` is provided and the name ends with it, the extension is stripped.

Examples: - basename('/a/b/c.txt') -<!-- -->&gt; 'c.txt' - basename('/a/b/c.txt', '.txt') -<!-- -->&gt; 'c' - basename('/') -<!-- -->&gt; ''


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[dirname(path)](doc/markdown/./base.pathutils.dirname.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Returns the directory name (parent directory) of a path.

Behavior: - Applies `normalize` first. - If the path is root "/" or has no parent, returns "/".

Examples: - dirname('/a/b/c') -<!-- -->&gt; '/a/b' - dirname('/a') -<!-- -->&gt; '/' - dirname('/') -<!-- -->&gt; '/'


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[extname(path)](doc/markdown/./base.pathutils.extname.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Returns the extension of the path, including the leading dot.

Behavior: - Based on the result of `basename`<!-- -->. - If there is no dot, returns an empty string.

Examples: - extname('/a/b/c.txt') -<!-- -->&gt; '.txt' - extname('/a/b/c') -<!-- -->&gt; ''


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[isAbsolute(path)](doc/markdown/./base.pathutils.isabsolute.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Determines whether the path is absolute.

Definition here: absolute paths start with "/".


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[join(paths)](doc/markdown/./base.pathutils.join.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Joins multiple path segments and normalizes the result.

Behavior: - Concatenates segments with "/" and then runs `normalize`<!-- -->. - The returned path is always absolute.

Example: - join('/a', 'b', '../c') -<!-- -->&gt; '/a/c'


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[normalize(path)](doc/markdown/./base.pathutils.normalize.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Normalizes a path by collapsing redundant slashes, removing "." segments, and resolving ".." segments.

Rules: - Multiple consecutive "/" are collapsed into a single "/". - "." segments are removed. - ".." removes the previous segment (no-op at root). - The result always starts with "/" (absolute form).

Example: - normalize('/a//b/./c/../d') -<!-- -->&gt; '/a/b/d'


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[relative(from, to)](doc/markdown/./base.pathutils.relative.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Computes a relative path from one path to another.

Behavior: - Both `from` and `to` are normalized first. - The returned path does not start with "/" (relative form). - If both resolve to the same path, returns ".".

Examples: - relative('/a/b/c', '/a/d/e') -<!-- -->&gt; '../../d/e' - relative('/a/b', '/a/b/c') -<!-- -->&gt; 'c' - relative('/a/b', '/a/b') -<!-- -->&gt; '.'


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[sanitizeFilename(filename, options)](doc/markdown/./base.pathutils.sanitizefilename.md)


</td><td>

`static`


</td><td>

Sanitizes a file or directory name by replacing or removing invalid characters.

Behavior: - Removes or replaces characters that are invalid in common filesystems. - Trims leading/trailing spaces and dots. - Collapses multiple spaces into single spaces. - Replaces reserved names with safe alternatives. - Optionally limits the length of the result.

Examples: - sanitizeFilename('my file.txt') -<!-- -->&gt; 'my file.txt' - sanitizeFilename('file:name\*.txt') -<!-- -->&gt; 'file\_name\_.txt' - sanitizeFilename(' .hidden ') -<!-- -->&gt; 'hidden' - sanitizeFilename('CON') -<!-- -->&gt; '\_CON' - sanitizeFilename('a'.repeat(300)) -<!-- -->&gt; (truncated to maxLength)


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
